text: Frédéric Passy (May 20, 1822 – June 12, 1912) was a French economist. In 1901 he received the first Nobel Peace Prize together with Henry Dunant. Passy wrote and talked to others about free trade. He followed the ideas of Richard Cobden. title: Frédéric Passy
